cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.category: Potential Tropical Cyclone / Tropical Storm (not yet a hurricane)
cyclone.current_location: about 80 mi (125 km) E of Chetumal, Mexico and about 280 mi (450 km) SSW of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn north today, move through the Yucatan Channel, then track north-north-east across the Gulf of Mexico toward the Florida Panhandle before accelerating northeastward across Georgia, the Carolinas, and the Mid-Atlantic states

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect for the Yucatan coast of Mexico from Tulum to Cabo Catoche
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for the Cuban provinces of Pinar del Rio and Isle of Youth
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Panhandle, Alabama coast, Georgia and South Carolina coasts, then inland across the Southeast and Mid-Atlantic (including Chesapeake Bay region)
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (5%) of tropical-storm-force winds; most likely breezy conditions with gusts 25–35 mph Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water-level rises possible in upper Chesapeake Bay (<3 ft)
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain Thursday–early Friday, 1–3 in., isolated 4 in.; potential urban/stream flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Potential river rises and port operational delays due to wet, gusty conditions; reduced visibilities and slippery surfaces on terminals
